item.title: ğŸ”§ Install & Update
item.description: ğŸ‘‰ If you wish to follow a Step-By-Step guide which show you how to send you first message via HTTP API please go to âš¡ Quick Start. Requirements # Operating System # You can use any operating system for host system (Linux, Windows or macOS) as long as you have Docker installed, and it can run Linux containers. Linux is the most recommended operating system for running Docker containers. Linux ğŸ‘‰ We suggest using Debian or Ubuntu based distributions.

item.title: ğŸ“Š Dashboard
item.description: Overview # Dashboard is a UI to manage your WhatsApp sessions! Download the Dashboard Overview video . You can access Dashboard by running the project and opening http://localhost:3000/dashboard (or similar, but with /dashboard at the end). â„¹ï¸ Default username and password: waha/waha docker run -it -p 3000:3000/tcp devlikeapro/waha-plus If you’re using API Key, remember to set up the key in the dashboard. Configuration # When running WAHA you can set the following environment variables to configure the dashboard:

item.title: ğŸ“š Swagger (OpenAPI)
item.description: Overview # The project provides HTTP API (REST), which is documented with OpenAPI specification and Swagger UI. Download the Swagger Overview video . You can see all available endpoints, request/response examples, and even execute them directly from the Swagger UI. Find the latest versions: Swagger documentation -> Postman -> OpenAPI specification -> You can find Swagger documentation on the following url after you install and started it: Swagger: http://localhost:3000. OpenAPI: http://localhost:3000/-json.

item.title: ğŸ“¤ Send messages
item.description: We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code. If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from âš¡ Quick Start. Features # WEBJS NOWEB POST /api/sendText âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendSeen âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ PUT /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ DELETE /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendImage âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendFile âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendVoice âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendVideo âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendPoll #189 âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendLocation âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/sendLinkPreview âœ”ï¸ POST /api/startTyping âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/stopTyping âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/{session}/presence âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/reaction âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ POST /api/star âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ GET /api/sendContactVcard âœ”ï¸ GET /api/messages âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸Â¹ GET /api/checkNumberStatus âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ NOWEB - you need to Enable Store to get chats, contacts and messages If you see the feature is not available in the above list, please create a feature request or leave “+1” comment on the existing one.

item.title: ğŸ“¥ Receive messages
item.description: We consider that you’ve run docker container and authenticated the session with QR code. If you haven’t yet - please follow the steps from Quick Start â†’. You must use Webhooks to receive messages from WhatsApp to your application. Start a new session with configured message event in webhooks - call POST /api/sessions/ with the payload: { "name": "default", "config": { "webhooks": [ { "url": "https://webhook.site/11111111-1111-1111-1111-11111111", "events": [ "message" ] } ] } } After that WAHA sends events (see below) about new messages to an endpoint you provided.

item.title: ğŸ–¥ï¸ Sessions
item.description: Overview # Session represents a WhatsApp Account (Phone Number) connected to WAHA that you can use to send and receive messages. Session Lifecycle # Before you can ğŸ“¤ Send or ğŸ“¥ Receive messages , you need to Create a session (optionally, Start) and authenticate it using QR code or pairing code. Here’s Session Lifecycle State Diagram: Click to open full size. Session Status # Here’s the list of possible session.status values:

item.title: ğŸ”„ Webhooks
item.description: The project uses Webhooks and Websockets to notify your application about the messages and events from WhatsApp. Webhooks are a way for two different applications to communicate with each other in real-time. When a certain event happens in one application, it sends a message to another application through a webhook URL. The receiving application can then take action based on the information received. Setup # Session webhooks # You can define webhooks configuration per session when you start it with POST /api/sessions/ request data.

item.title: ğŸŒ Proxy
item.description: Overview # If you’re experiencing issues scanning QR codes in WhatsApp, especially with Indian ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ phone numbers, using a proxy located close to the phone number’s location may help resolve the problem. It affects both WEBJS and NOWEB engines. ğŸ‘‰ If proxy doesn’t help but the project works on YOUR local laptop - check Tunneling. Symptoms # You start a new session in WhatsApp. Scan the QR code. Experience a long loading time.

item.title: ğŸ“¶ Polls
item.description: Waiting for WEBJS engine to support it, and we’ll add it ASAP! Endpoints # See the list of engines that support the feature ->. Send poll # Use the endpoint to send a poll! POST /api/sendPoll The request body is pretty simple: { "session": "default", "chatId": "123123123@c.us", "poll": { "name": "How are you?", "options": [ "Awesome!", "Good!", "Not bad!" ], "multipleAnswers": false } } The response you get back: { "id": "true_321321321@c.

item.title: ğŸ’¬ Chats
item.description: Chats methods. Features # Here’s the list of features that are available by ğŸ­ Engines: WEBJS NOWEB Get all chats GET /api/{session}/chats âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸Â¹ Archive chat POST /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/archive âœ”ï¸ #445 Unarchive chat POST /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/unarchive âœ”ï¸ #445 Delete chat DELETE /api/{session}/chats/{chatId} âœ”ï¸ Get messages GET /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸Â¹ Edit message PUT /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ Delete message DELETE /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages/{messageId} âœ”ï¸ âœ”ï¸ Delete all messages DELETE /api/{session}/chats/{chatId}/messages âœ”ï¸ NOWEB - you need to Enable Store to get chats, contacts and messages If you see the feature is not available in the above list, please create a feature request or leave “+1” comment on the existing one.
